main event: On 23rd May 1955 in Elyria, Ohio, a black cigar-shaped object, the size of a B-47 type aircraft, was observed for three seconds at a very high altitude.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only three seconds due to poor visibility.
The object was initially believed to be a commercial aircraft due to heavy air traffic in the area.
The speed of the object was estimated at 2000 MPH, with unusual slow speeds at times.
The observation involved multiple witnesses, with an original visibility of up to 16 miles according to 3 to 5 observers.
The conclusion of the report indicated that no further action was contemplated for investigation due to the short duration of the sighting and the perceived lack of warrant for further investigation.
sighted object: A black cigar-shaped object, the size of a B-47 type aircraft, at high altitude
